definition: to take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
details:
verb
- to take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
= example: to take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
= synonyms: start
- to set in motion, cause to start
= example: to set in motion, cause to start
= synonyms: commence, lead off, start
- to achieve or accomplish in the least degree, usually used in the negative
= example: to achieve or accomplish in the least degree, usually used in the negative
- to start an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object
= example: to start an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object
= synonyms: start
- to have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense
= example: to have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense
= synonyms: start
- to have a beginning characterized in some specified way
= example: to have a beginning characterized in some specified way
= synonyms: start
- to be the first item or point, constitute the beginning or start, come first in a series
= example: to be the first item or point, constitute the beginning or start, come first in a series
